CHAT.comment: Deborah J. Davidson , Angela L. Atkinson Duina

The mood surrounding the activity seems pleasant. Mot and Chi are friendly to each other , but spend much of their time playing independently. Mot does most of the talking. EXP remains in the background throughout the activity. Reference to the qualities of magnets is limited to comments by Mot that pennies will not stick to magnets. There is considerable experimentation with repulsion when Mot and Chi notice that different objects will move across the table because of the pressure of the magnets. Chi puts a washer underneath the plastic turtle's shell and is thus able to pick it up with the yellow wand. MOT and Chi sit at a table in the kitchen; the magnets are spread out on the table in front of them; Chi is stacking objects on the black base

u.a: reaches across the table to get the yellow wand
picks up objects from the table with the yellow wand
removes a silver man from the yellow wand
talks about focusing the camera
stands a silver man on the black base; it falls down
holds a silver man about a foot above the table
holds up a silver man for Mot to see
places a silver man on the black base
stacks a silver man on top of another silver man; the top silver man stands with one foot on one of the other man's hand
removes a silver man from the black base
stacks a silver man on top of the silver-man tower on the black base
places a silver man in the upside-down position on the tower of silver men

g.ga: placing another silver man on the tower
with the silver man in an upside down position

u.a: places a silver man in an upside-down position on the tower
places another silver man on the silver-man tower
the tower falls
mumbled
begins to play with a strange silver bowl-like object on the table
places a silver stick vertically on a nut which is on the black base
picks up nuts from the table
places a silver man in a horizontal position on top of the silver stick
attempts to place a nut on top of the horizontal silver man , but the nut falls off
removes the vertical silver stick with some effort
picks up the plastic green turtle
holds a silver stick a half-inch away from the base
grabs onto the silver stick in Mot's hand , but Mot doesn't let him take it
pressure is the repulsion between the black base and the silver stick
demonstrates how to hold the silver stick above the base; then , gives the silver stick to Chi
shakes head
Chi is holding the silver stick with his hands , but Mot wants Chi to hold the stick in a different way
demonstrates using a washer how she wants Chi to hold the stick
the washer sticks to the base

g.ga: repulsion between black base and silver stick

u.a: nods head
places a penny on the black base
MOT calls Chi's attention to a washer which she has balanced atop a vertical silver stick on the black base
holds out the plastic sheep for Mot to see
quiet
tries to hang the plastic orange man from the washer on the silver stick
continues to hold out the sheep
MOT isn't paying attention to the sheep
Chi is trying to get Mot's attention
the orange man , silver stick , and washer fall down
talks about camera
talks about camera view .
talks about getting paid .

g.ga: purple star magnet with a silver man on top of it

u.a: hands Chi a nut from the table
Chi is making a tower of nuts on the black base
there are no bolts in the set
lines up the washer on the table , comparing the line of washers to the tower of nuts
places another nut on top of the tower

g.ga: on top of the nut tower

u.a: MOT and Chi stack the washers on top of the tower of nuts
all washers except one fall off the tower
removes one of the fallen washers from the black base with some effort

the washer still on the tower is perpendicular to the tower of nuts; the washer sticks out from the top of the nut tower like a small diving board; Mot hangs a washer from the bottom of the washer and wants to see how many other washers will hang like that
tries to hang another washer below the first one which Mot hung , but it won't attach to the other washer
tries to hang a second washer as well , but Mot's doesn't attach either and the first hanging washer swivels away (is repelled away) from the washer Mot is attempting to hang
attaches a washer to the side of the nut tower , parallel to and underneath the <diving-board> washer
the diving-board washer , the one parallel to it , the hanging washer and the side of the nut tower make a square
tries to hang a washer below the square described above , but the washer falls
places a washer over one of the empty spaces in the square , forming five sides of a cube
removes the fallen washer from the base with effort
MOT is commenting on her difficulting removing the washer from the black base
indicates the unfinished side of the cube with her finger

g.ga: on the unfinished side of the cube

u.a: MOT tries to use a silver man to cover the open side , but Chi puts a washer there instead; in doing so Chi causes the bottom to fall out of the cube , but it remains attached to the structure
Chi is unaware that the bottom of the cube has fallen out
tries to reattach the bottom of the cube , but it falls
<$=8> Mot and Chi speak in low voices and it's very hard to hear them
MOT and Chi remove objects from the black base
puts a silver stick through the hole in a nut
holds up a nut on one of the silver sticks
Chi plays with the silver bowl and black base; ignoring Mot
MOT continues holding the nut on the stick , and Chi looks at it briefly

g.ga: on black base , next to the first nut
in between the other two nuts

u.a: MOT changes her mind about putting a nut in between the other two

g.ga: nut which was on the silver stick

u.a: removes the nut from the silver stick and holds it out for Chi
places a smaller nut on each of the larger nuts which have been placed on the black base .
picks the nut up and sets it aside on the table
holds out the silver stick for Chi
puts the silver stick through the center of a nut which is on the black base
Chi doesn't want Mot to put the silver stick there; Mot removes the stick

g.ga: nuts which Chi is stacking on black base

u.a: points to the area on the base where the structure might fall
Chi is struggling to get a washer to attach to the nuts on the black base

g.ga: got the washer to stick to the nuts
get the washer to stick to nuts

u.a: Chi has constructed an arching bridge on the black base
prepares to place another washer on the bridge; in doing so , one of the bridge pieces falls .
another bridge piece falls
Chi is having difficulty removing a washer from the black base

g.ga: removing objects from the black base

u.a: Chi has stacked the nuts , making a tower; a silver stick is placed on top of the tower and perpendicular to it , like the arms of a scarecrow
a nut which Chi placed on the top of the nut tower fell off , and rolled down the side of the tower
atop the tower of nuts is a silver stick , standing straight up; Mot suggests putting the silver man on top of the silver stick .
tries to balance the silver man on the silver stick , but is unable to do it
repeatedly touches the thin magnet to the black base; it does not seem to stick
picks up the plastic turtle

g.ga: next to and under the silver bowl

u.a: removes an object from the bottom of the silver bowl , which is apparently magnetic
pushes over a green triangle on the black base
using the yellow wand , Chi places a washer atop the silver stick which is standing straight up; it stays briefly , and then falls
tries to put the yellow wand on the black base , but the base and the wand repel each other
as Chi tries to place the wand on the black base , the base is repelled and moves across the table

g.ga: put the wand on the black base

u.a: hands the wand to Mot
the wand attaches to the base and Mot and Chi are surprised
nods head
Chi places the purple star on the silver stick which is standing straight up on the tower of nuts on the black base; the silver stick and the star fall
Chi tries to remove the silver stick from the tower of nuts; Mot moves the base , upon which the tower stands , toward Chi with the wand; this catches Chi off-guard
the side to which Mot refers attracts the wand instead of repelling it
slides the wand across the table and picks up various objects

Chi holds the silver bowl in the air with various magnetic objects dangling from it; Mot puts the yellow wand at the bottom of the dangling objects; the objects stick to the wand and detach from the silver bowl

g.ga: silver man at the bottom of the chain of objects which are attached to the silver bowl
silver stick , a washer , and two balls
that objects become magnetic when they touch magnets

u.a: picks up objects with the pieces dangling from the silver bowl and then drops them off onto the base
plays with the yellow wand; circling it around a silver man in order to make the man move; the man attaches to the wand and Mot is surprised
with his crane , Chi has moved a silver man from the table to the base; interestingly , the silver man is dropped so that it stands on the base
moves the red ball closer to Chi
moves the thin refrigerator magnet closer to Chi
picks up a silver stick .

g.ga: pick up a washer with two silver sticks at the bottom of the chain instead of just one

u.a: Chi is trying to pick up a washer , but with two sticks attached to the chain at the bottom of the silver bowl , there isn't enough strength; Chi says that the washer is <too powerful>

g.ga: off the chain dangling from the silver bowl

u.a: moves the green triangle out of the way so Chi can pick up a washer from the table
watches Chi as he moves objects from the table to the base
MOT looks on as Chi moves the green triangle across the table; Chi cannot pick up the green triangle entirely , but he can slide it across the table with his crane
mumbled .

g.ga: silver stick at the bottom of the chain

u.a: as Chi moves the chain over the base , the silver stick is repelled and moves up to an angle instead of hanging straight down
pushes a silver man so that it rocks back and forth against the black base , making clicking noises
begins removing objects from the black base; one of the objects falls onto the floor; Chi bends down to get it
holds out an object , which he just found on the floor , to Mot
Chi found another object in addition to the piece that fell on the floor
clears objects off the black base
holds turtle
attempts to put the red ball underneath the turtle's shell , but finds that the ball doesn't fit well
puts a washer underneath the turtle's shell
tries to pick up the turtle with the silver bowl , but is unable to do so
MOT lifts up the wand to hand it to Chi; Chi lifts up the turtle to touch it to the wand
lifts up the plastic turtle , which has the washer under its shell , with the yellow wand
removes a silver stick from the bottom of the silver bowl
picks up the turtle and works to put another washer underneath its shell
picks up the turtle with the yellow wand
removes the silver bowl from the black base , and clears off the objects which are attached to the silver bowl
prepares to touch the turtle with the silver bowl
picks up the turtle with the silver bowl
MOT didn't think the bowl would pick up the turtle , but it does
MOT and Chi begin playing with the silver men on the black base
one of the silver men falls over
stands a silver stick on the black base and slides a washer over the stick .

g.ga: on top of the silver men

u.a: the tower of silver men , which Mot was constructing on the base , fell
stacks nuts and washers over two silver sticks which stand one on top of the other

g.ga: height of the the two silver sticks

u.a: moves the top silver stick further down into the tube of washers and nuts

hits a standing silver man with his finger , accidently and without realizing it; this causes the silver man to rock back and forth , and to make a clicking sound; Chi looks at Mot , wondering what made the silver man move
hits another silver man to show Chi how the silver man started to move; instead , the silver man falls down
repeatedly taps the silver man lightly , making it rock back and forth
tries the same thing again with the other silver man , but the silver man falls again

g.ga: rock back and forth without falling over
making Mot's silver man rock back and forth without falling down

u.a: mousetrap is a comparison of how Mot's silver man snaps quickly down on the base like the metal bar on a mousetrap
picks up her silver man and sets it closer to Chi's to see if it will rock back and forth somewhere else on the base
tries to get Mot's silver man to rock , but is unable to do so

g.ga: another silver man which was lying on the table
made Mot's silver man rock back and forth
what allows the silver men to rock
specific area in center of base

u.a: indicates the space she is referring to with her finger
moves her silver man to the space indicated on the base and taps the silver man to make it rock; it works
refers to two silver men rocking at the same time and near each other
tries to put a third silver man in between the two <dancing partners>

g.ga: putting a third silver man between the two silver men

u.a: Chi has a arranged the three silver men so that they stand close together , one in front of the other; they are all rocking
talking about Chi
